sub_title: Hotel General Manager at Holland America Line
summary:
Creating a sustainable atmosphere while increasing and maximizing the shareholders value. 

Versatile and adaptive professional who enjoys working in a fast paced environment. Quick learner, willing and with good conceptualization skills. 

Always paying attention to detail without forgetting the overall picture. Likes delivering a high quality product and ensuring excellent guest services and satisfaction. 

Enjoys working with a team and maximizing the teams' output by optimizing and using all skills and strength available. Training on the job as well as staying tuned with all latest trends and innovations.

By effectively planning, leading,  organizing and controlling processes,  maximum results will be achieved.

Good communication and diplomacy skills. Likes developing new strategies and perpetually increase the performance of the overall processes of creation, delivery and monitoring. 

Interested in a broad range of fields relating to the event, entertainment and hospitality industry.

Appraisals of working experiences and certificates upon request.

profile_positions.description:
Department: Hotel Department
Rank: Ships Staff Officer
Reports To: Captain and, indirectly, to the Vice President - Marine Hotel, Cruise Operations
Subordinates: All Marine Hotel Personnel (approximately 600 employees)

Responsible for the efficient and effective overall management and operation of the Marine Hotel.

Major Responsibilities:

- Schedule, train, monitor and evaluate assigned personnel

- Ensure that maximum service is achieved throughout every area of the Marine Hotel

- Monitor onboard revenue to ensure projected sales and appropriate service

- Oversee shipboard entertainment programs and activities, to ensure that program quality and content meet acceptable standards

- Oversee ship concessionaires (Casino, Spa and Salon, Shops and Photo department) to ensure they conform with requirements

- Ensure that shipboard staff is aware of all aspects of safety at work and basic safety rules

- Responsible for all crew matters in the Hotel Department: including crew reception, crew lodging and feeding, crew cabins and messes, crew welfare and recreation, uniforms, equipment, etc.

- Responsible for the adherence to USPH regulations and for conducting inspections as necessary

- Responsible for controlling established food and beverage budgets

profile_positions.description:
Department: Hotel Department
Rank: Hotel Officer
Reports To: Hotel Director
Subordinates: All F&B employees (approximately 400 employees)

Responsible for the overall culinary and dining service operation onboard the ship. Direct the activities of the Asst. Manager – Culinary Operations, Executive Chef, Provision Master and Maitre' D Hotel.

Major Responsibilities:

- Directs, coordinates and supervises the implementation and execution of Marine Hotel policies, standards and procedures within the Culinary and Dining Services Department

- Directs, coordinates and supervises the implementation and execution of job specification and cleaning procedures in accordance with USPH standards

- Directs, coordinates and supervises the activities of subordinates assigned to the function comprising the Culinary and Dining Services Department

- Directs, coordinates and supervises the training of all subordinates in various functions within the department

- Responsible for the ordering, loading, storing and issuing of all Marine Hotel Supplies (excluding beverage and medical supplies)

- Responsible for keeping adequate inventory levels and managing inventory targets of all Marine Hotel supplies

- Responsible for the store room operation including the storage and distribution of all hotel supplies excluding medical

- Responsible for meeting targets and staying within budgets (GSS ratings, food cost, general supplies cost and wage costs)

- Prepares or causes to be prepared objective performance evaluation reports including progress against the set objectives for officers, petty officers and other employees in this department

- Attends all staff meetings with the Hotel Director and once a week the Captain's staff meeting on sanitation

- Is chairman of the Onboard Sanitation Committee. Committee meets weekly with each department and sub-department represented

- Is directly responsible for the overall operation of the garbage sanitation area onboard the ship

profile_positions.description:
Department: Hotel department, Culinary
Rank: Hotel Officer
Reports to: Culinary Operations Manager
Subordinates: All F&B service employees

The Assistant Culinary Operations Manager directs the activities of the Lido restaurant and room service and assists the Culinary Operations Manager with the operation of mess rooms, crew bars, storerooms, environmental issues, dishwashing and preparation of all reorders.

Major responsibilities are:

- Directing the daily operation of the vessels Culinary operation

- Responsible for the overall training of the Culinary team

- Develop and recommend merchandising and promotional programs to maximize passenger revenue

- Achieving passenger quality standards and rating for food services

- Assure food facilities are maintained at company standards and meet or exceed USPH requirements
profile_positions.title: Assistant Culinary Operations Manager

profile_positions.description:
Department: Hotel department, Culinary
Rank: Hotel Officer
Reports to: Dining Room Manager
Subordinates: All Dining Room Service Staff

Assists the Dining Room Manager in providing superior food and beverage service and product by managing and directing staff (approcimatelly 150) in the dining room and other outlets

Major responsibilities are:

- Responsible for an assigned section in the dining room. Ensures continued presence in the work area during meal times and verifies daily with guests that their service and food satisfaction expectations are met

- Responsible for the preparation and implementation of all table reservations and seating    assignments with final approval by the Dining Room Manager

- Responsible for ensuring that all Dining Room Stewards and Assistant Dining Room Stewards offering and selling all beverages (except wines by the bottle and After Dinner Drinks) and meeting or exceeding set beverages revenue targets

- Assists the Dining Room Manager in directing, supervising and training of all subordinates in the performance of their duties in accordance with set HAL standards

- Assists the Dining Room Manager in the preparation of performance objectives and evaluations for the Crew Care Supervisor, Host and other employees in the dining services areas

- Assists in the preparation of work schedules for all employees in the restaurant

- Manages and controls scheduling of overtime

- Responsible for the implementation and execution of food handling, food service and cleaning procedures in accordance with USPH standards

- Responsible for the implementation and execution of beverage service in the dining room; ensures the selling and upselling of revenue beverages and provides support to the Dining Room Steward in problem solving solutions as well as unsatisfied guest recovery

- Adapts and adjusts to projects and assignments as dictated by ship and or corporate management.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Dining Room Manager

profile_positions.description:
Department: Hotel department, Culinary
Rank: Hotel Officer
Reports to: Culinary Operations Manager
Subordinates: Assistant Provision Master, Storekeeper, Assistant Storekeeper, Storeroom Attendants

The provision master is responsible for issuing of goods. Receives, signs for, issues, assists in counting and reorders all Food, Sales and General Supplies. Directs all the activities in the Storeroom

The major responsibilities are:

- Responsible for the issuing of goods following the companies accounting procedures

- Responsible to execute and implement proper maintenance and cleaning procedures in all Storeroom areas in order to ensure good appearance and condition of these areas

- Ensures compliance of USPH standards and other Health Authorities as appropriate

- To execute all the administration that is necessary to achieve an up-do-date inventory list

- Responsible for overall direction, supervision and personal conduct of all employees assigned to the Storeroom operation

- To supervise the loading and landing of goods

- Checks the condition of the goods, if they are stored properly in order to comply with the health, sanitation and safety standards

- Responsible for the preparation of all required reports and manifests from the respective computer systems – e.g. Excel, Word, Outlook, Inventory System.
profile_positions.title: Provision Master

profile_positions.description:
Department: Hotel Department, Administration
Rank:Hotel Officer
Reports to: Hotel Manager
Subordinates: Clerk Marine Hotel, Assistant Controller Marine Hotel Operations

The controller is responsible for ensuring proper administration of budget results and inventory control on all Marine Hotel Purchases. It gives operational reviews to individual budgets and all shipboard revenue centres concerning the general control of the Hotel Department.

Major responsibilities are:

- Taking physical inventory is taken of all bar inventory

- Storing all hotel purchases in the designated loading ports

- Performing quality and quantity spot checks for food cost, production control, spoilage control and inventory control

- Input of all budget results per voyage with all sales figures, food- /general supply costs 

- monitoring storeroom inventory control
profile_positions.title: Controller Marine Hotel Operations
